user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtAssert_GetValueText:
```c
static const char *UtAssert_GetValueText(char *TempBuf, size_t TempSz, UT_IntCheck_t InValue, bool IsUnsigned,
                                         UtAssert_Radix_t RadixType)
{
    if (RadixType == UtAssert_Radix_BOOLEAN)
    {
        if (InValue != 0)
        {
            snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "true");
        }
        else
        {
            snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "false");
        }
    }
    else if (RadixType == UtAssert_Radix_OCTAL)
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "0%lo", (unsigned long)InValue);
    }
    else if (RadixType == UtAssert_Radix_HEX)
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "0x%lx", (unsigned long)InValue);
    }
    else if (IsUnsigned)
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "%lu", (unsigned long)InValue);
    }
    else
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "%ld", (long)InValue);
    }

    return TempBuf;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function UtAssert_GetValueText:
UT_IntCheck_t InValue
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No code fragment in the function modifies a function parameter itself. Details:
- TempBuf is passed to snprintf as the destination buffer; this modifies the object pointed to by the pointer parameter, which is permitted by the rule. The pointer TempBuf itself is never assigned to, incremented, or otherwise modified in the function.
- TempSz, InValue, IsUnsigned and RadixType are passed by value and are not assigned to anywhere in the function. The code only reads them (comparisons, casts, and passing to snprintf), which does not constitute modification of the parameter.
- The casts (e.g. (unsigned long)InValue) are value conversions for the call and do not modify the parameter.
- Returning TempBuf does not modify the parameter.
Because there are no assignments to any parameter variables and no pointer parameter is reassigned, there are no fragments that need investigation for violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
